Dear Ms. Schultz:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 01/25/2023.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and MISEP
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (734) 395-0920.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
Trends and Repeat Violation Assessment
The renewal evaluation completed 11/15/2021 determined no areas of
noncompliance. The current interim evaluation found two violations with 324(4), and
509(3).
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment reviewed the corrective action plan action
steps that led to no violations identified in the renewal evaluation. It also reviewed
the agency’s performance in compliance with key performance indicators.
Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. The staff turnover
and resulting transition over the past year was discussed. The agency minimized
new caseloads to assist in the transition for line and administrative staff.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety alerts and the comments by foster parents and relatives were
generally positive regarding the support provided to them by the agency and staff.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
